heaviest_rainfall.status: The largest amount of rain ever recorded is on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm fell at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour over the 37.2 hour event.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The rain rate reached 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, and resulted in 21.19mm of rain over 15.0 hours.  This is the highest rate recorded by our weather station.

longest_rain.status: The longest rain storm on record lasted 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm of rain fell and at one point was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning strikes in one day since 11 April 2025 is 23 and it happened on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: No storms are expected.  The last storm was observed on 28 September 2025 and continued for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is no cold snap at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 cold snaps, with an average of 3.7 per year.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is no heatwaves at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 heatwavess, with an average of 1.9 per year.

tropical.status: The previous tropical night was on 18 July 2025, with only 62 in total since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (190°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The highest wind gust ever seen is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The record wind run remains at 1737 miles from 21 October 2012.

speed.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind speed recorded on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 4.7°C), outside temperature (down 4.1°C), and inside temperature (down 1.6°C).

The past week and month had observable variation in dew point temperature (up 45.8°C), feels like temperature (up 47.7°C), outside temperature (up 47.7°C), and cloud levels (down 192 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 295.7m higher than yesterday, 191.8m higher than the past week, 354.6m higher than the past month.

The cloud levels yesterday fell between 821m minimum and 3400m maximum, with an average of 2090m; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 1898.7m and 1735.9m.
cloud levels.summary: The clouds will be high, plenty of sunshine is expected.

summary.summary: Inside; anticipate mild and comfortable temperatures. Outside; moderate and mild. Also, air moisture should feel ok and little or no wind. Possible light showers, the clouds will be high, plenty of sunshine is expected, and some sunny spells will occur. Weather patterns to stay the same.

washing.phrase: The conditions are favourable for drying your laundry outside right now but, as always, monitor the situation for changes to the weather.
